fields.title: Murder on the Orient Express
fields.description: Murder on the Orient Express is a work of detective fiction by English writer Agatha Christie featuring the Belgian detective Hercule Poirot.

fields.title: Death on the Nile
fields.description: Death on the Nile is a work of detective fiction by British writer Agatha Christie, published in the UK by the Collins Crime Club on 1 November 1937 [1] and in the US by Dodd, Mead and Company the following year.

fields.title: Crooked House
fields.description: Crooked House is a work of detective fiction by Agatha Christie first published in the US by Dodd, Mead and Company in March 1949[1] and in the UK by the Collins Crime Club on 23 May of the same year.

fields.title: Only the Brave
fields.description: A powerful new novel from Danielle Steel, whose countless #1 New York Times bestselling novels have made her one of Americaâ€™s favorite storytellers.

fields.title: The Pirate
fields.description: Unaware of his true heritage, a man who was raised by a wealthy Arab family learns that power and fortune are not the only reasons for living.

fields.title: 79 Park Avenue
fields.description: Marja starts out a tough girl from the mean streets of New York. Ambitious and driven, over time she rises from street urchin to stripper, later re-inventing herself as Maryann Flood, the queen of an empire of pleasure.
